comments.body: Seems like the relevant warnings about "don't use this on >2 node clusters" should probably be here (ideally also checked and enforced by the module at runtime, but it's your show).

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +14,18 @@DOCUMENTATION = '''
author: "Suhas Bangalore Shekar (bsuhas@netapp.com), Archana Ganesan (garchana@netapp.com)"
description:
  - "Enable or disable HA on a cluster"
extends_documentation_fragment:

comments.body: Module impl is not idempotent- always returns `changed: true`. Is the underlying API idempotent, or will it blow up if it's already in the requested state?
The underlying API doesn't care about the existing state. It sets the state to the requested state (enabled or disabled)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +93,97 @@        cserver = netapp_utils.setup_na_ontap_zapi(module=self.module, vserver=results)
        netapp_utils.ems_log_event("na_ontap_cluster", cserver)
        if self.state == 'present':
            self.modify_cluster_ha("true")
            changed = True
